title: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content: Hi. I would like to say you that i have very good news: i made 10 new levels for Keen 4-6 and just sent them to Xtraverse. So they will be available soon. I included the Readme in my levels pack. Please read this file, because it contains list of warp codes (F10-W).[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
Cool. Apart from ChargingMoose's hex-edited (that's how it was created, wasn't it?) Keen 4 level, I can't remember any other fanmade levels for Keen 4-6...

I look forward to playing some new levels finally.--------------

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
There have actually been several level packs for Keen 4-6, although most of them were made for Keen 5.

[url=http://www.keengrid.net/ckgalaxy/tgmm.php?way=one&id=50]Torgopolis[/url] - This was Benvolio's one level Keen 4 mod. It has graphics in the "flat" style of the original Keen games, though.
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/ckgalaxy/tgmm.php?way=one&id=19]Birdman[/url] - As far as I can remember, this is a one level "proof of concept" that demonstrated what could be changed in the Keen: Galaxy trilogy.
Quirky Moron's [url=http://andy.durdin.net/keen/modding/files/mods/quirkym.zip]Keen 4[/url] and [url=http://www.freewebs.com/quirky_moron/Fire_station_beta.zip]Keen 5[/url] levels - These are stand-alone levels, but quite large and complex.

There are others, but I can't find them at present.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
Then there's CK Guy's Keen 5 level pack.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] That isn't yet finished though, but there has been several demos/betas of it already.


Anyways, SupFanat.. These levels are awesome!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] Haven't completed all of them yet. They're pretty good. There may be something key missing in your second Keen 4 level, or perhaps I just can't find it.. One Keen 6 level may have something wrong as well, but I need to search more if there's something switch or stuff I haven't noticed. Good work!Eat your veggies!

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content: It seems that i've tested all my levels before sending them to Xtraverse. As far as i know, all my keen 6 levels are hard, but possible. Yes, they contains lots of switches. I'll test them again. Which level for Keen 6 seems to be wrong? Don't forget to play all other levels.[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Haven't completed all of them yet[hr][/quote]
I remember only one my unfinished level: Miragia replacemement for Keen 4. All others seems to be finished.

Hi, people. Please download the file from a Xtraverse post. And don't hide your opinion about my levels: write it here. I want very much to know it.

Also, my levelset is first new levelset for Keen 6. Horrow! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] [img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
Wow, these are pretty good. You like putting Keen in danger the instant he starts a level, don't you? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Not sure which version of Keen5 you need though, I thought I had 1.4 but it tells me it's an unknown version. Apart from that little hitch though, it works fine under DOSBox...

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Wow, these are pretty good.[hr][/quote]
I am glad that you like my levels. Thank you.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]You like putting Keen in danger the instant he starts a level, don't you? [hr][/quote]
Yes, i like to do so. I like dangers, especially those, which are used rarely in the original levels (Like the small tar in Keen 4 - It was used only in the level "Isle of tar" and nowhere else)[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Not sure which version of Keen5 you need though, I thought I had 1.4 but it tells me it's an unknown version[hr][/quote]
Did you unpacked the Keen 5 executable with UNLZEXE? If no, do it now: open the folder and drop the file Keen5.exe (or Keen5e.exe) into the file Unlzexe.exe. Yo'll see the message: File is decompressed. Then try again to start my levelset.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Apart from that little hitch though, it works fine under DOSBox... [hr][/quote]
As far as i know, the CKPatch doens't work under DOSBox, so this utilite is useless for playing a new levels for Keen[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke.gif[/img]

I started making of the New Miragia (replacement for original Miragia, very unfinished level), so it'll be playable soon. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-birthday.gif[/img] [img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: 10 New levels for Keen 4-6!!
content:
Did you unpacked the Keen 5 executable with UNLZEXE?

Yep, I tried Keen5 v1.0 normal, K5v1.0 unlzexe'd, K5v1.4 normal and K5v1.4 unlzexe'd but none of them worked [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

As far as i know, the CKPatch doens't work under DOSBox, so this utilite is useless for playing a new levels for Keen

Perhaps you need a new version of DOSBox? I'm running v0.63 and I've never had a problem with CKPatch.

EDIT: Okay, so I had v1.0 in my v1.4 folder. Now I tried it with the *proper* v1.4 and it almost worked, except yes, CK5Patch now makes Keen crash. Funny, CK4Patch and CK6Patch both work fine with DOSBox...

title: Hmm...
content:
[hr]Malvineous I'm running v0.63 and I've never had a problem with CKPatch.
[hr]That's weird... .61 is the latest version that I (and most others from what I can tell) have had trouble with regarding ckxpatch. Though I don't believe I've tried ck4-6patch, only 1-3.

Edit Huh? That's not what I meant to say at all. Version .61 is the last one that works with ckxpatch, in my experience, since IIRK there was something about .62-3 that removed some component from the original DOS emulation that had allowed it to function. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

content:

It was used in the pyramid levels too. Nonetheless, it's nice hazard element.[hr][/quote]

I meant the "small" tar, which is bulit into the normal sufrace. Pyramids use only "big" tar.[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Re: Hmm...
content: Ah, I see what you mean. You're right..Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Hmm...
content:
I have good news for you. I did not abandon my level project, but continued it. The lastest results are:

I continued making of the Miragia replacement for Keen 4, so it is more finished new.
The cosmic level for Keen 6 was not working: when you drop the green gem into gemholder the game chashes. This problem has been fixed.
I started two new levels: one for Keen 6 (replaces the level First Dome of Darkness, uses mainly the blue backgound), and one for Keen 5 (Replaces the level "The Security center", uses the same background and color of walls as that level). But they're not finished.
So you will have more levels soon.[img]http://classicgaming.com/cc314/encyclopedia/images/enemyk4-wormouth.gif[/img]

title: Ok
content: That's very good! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I didn't even think you would abandon it..Eat your veggies!

title: Re: Ok
content:
If you have Windows ME, 2000 or XP then Keen is unlikely to run properly - this is because those versions of Windows do not support DOS fully. If your PC is fast, DOSBox should solve the problem.[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Ok
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]When I try to play "The Perilous Pit", I get an error message - Insufficient memory to play level[hr][/quote]
